backend.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer
backend.description:
DescriptionLocation:Â Warsaw, Cracow, GdaÅ„skAbout VoltVolt is revolutionising how people pay online, globally. Our technology frees consumers from cards by letting them â€˜Pay by Bankâ€™. Itâ€™s effortless. Itâ€™s lightning fast. Itâ€™s the future. For businesses everywhere, itâ€™s transformative.Weâ€™re already trusted by leading brands around the world, but the real-time revolution is only just beginning. Having raised $83.5m, weâ€™re accelerating our mission of delivering real-time payments, everywhere. And thatâ€™s where you come in.We need world-class talent to create a world where consumers pay, and businesses get paid, instantly. With headquarters in London and offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, KrakÃ³w and Warsaw â€“ and an all-star team already in place â€“ weâ€™re sure youâ€™ll fit right in.About the projects
Fuzebox is our customersâ€™ command and control centre. Itâ€™s where they manage integrations to Voltâ€™s products, monitor transactions and access valuable data. As a Frontend Software Engineer, youâ€™ll work across the user-facing development lifecycle, building leading-edge disruptive financial technology solutions using React, TypeScript, Redux, Storybook and Playwright.
Checkout is a set of interfaces for payment requests processing. This is where the payer selects their bank and provides all the necessary details to initialize the payment. Youâ€™ll be using NX, React, (Svelte, NodeJS), TypeScript and CSS.
What the role involves:
Develop frontend software applications using your extensive knowledge of React, TypeScript and CSS,
Participate in software design meetings and analyse user needs to determine technical requirements,
Write efficient, reusable and maintainable code, whilst adhering to coding standards,
Use of modern frameworks to make the optimum solution that fits the requirements,
Test and maintain these software products to ensure continuing strong functionality,
Recommend improvements to existing software packages,
Manage time appropriately and clearly communicate changes in effort or scope,
Contribute to documentation where required,
Maintain a high awareness of industry issues and trends.
About you:
You have at least 4-5 years of experience in developing web applications,
You have in-depth knowledge of the React and its ecosystems,
We expect you to have practical experience of state and side effects management patterns and solutions (e.g. Redux, Redux Toolkit, Redux-Saga, Vuex),
You have experience with TypeScript,
You have experience working in an Agile, CI/CD environment,
You are focused on delivering a quality product using best practices,
You have excellent analytical, problem-solving, and technical troubleshooting skills,
You have experience collaborating on software projects with design and backend aspects,
You have a strong eye for compelling visual and user-centered design,
You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and can adapt to changing requirements,
You possess strong communication skills, ability to explain your decisions to the team in written and spoken English.
Nice to have:
You have experience in writing tests for React application utilising Vitest and Playwright,
You have worked on maintaining a component library using Storybook and Chromatic,
You have worked with monorepo using NX,
Prior experience with FinTech products.
What happens next?
Selected candidates will be invited for an initial interview with our People & Culture representative. The video meeting will take approximately 30-45 minutes,
Then itâ€™s time for a technical interview! The meeting will be conducted by two Technical Recruiters from Frontend area and will last 1.5 hours,
Our SVP of Technology would also like to chat with you :) You can expect the meeting to last approximately 45 minutes,
If successful, you will be given a job offer proposal.
Benefits
We champion â€˜extreme ownershipâ€™ â€“ being not just the owner of your own tasks, but a key member of a team united by, and accountable for, common goals,
During the week we mostly work remotely but for those who prefer to be in the office we arranged coworking spaces in Warsaw (Business Link Astoria) and Cracow (Loftmill),
Every week our employees meet and enjoy working together at the Puro Hotels in Cracow (on Thursdays), Warsaw (on Tuesdays) and Gdansk (Mondays). There is always an opportunity to eat lunch together and grab some drinks after hours,
Every occasion is a good reason for celebration; we organise Christmas parties and company retreats,
We care about our employeesâ€™ health, so you will be provided with Multisport card and medical insurance by Luxmed,
We offer paid holidays (pssst...we will give you one day off extra for your birthday),
In addition, once every two months on Friday we close down all comms at Volt - a digital detox. The whole business is officially ordered to take the day off!
If you want to work in a company with a great, start-up atmosphere, you donâ€™t have to look further :)
At Volt, diversity and inclusion are integral to our culture.We believe in hiring for cultural add, embracing difference and fostering a safe space where everyone can bring their authentic selves. Our mission is to transform the payments industry and this is only possible through the power of our diverse and talented team.Join us in making real-time payments accessible for all.

backend.title: Senior Python Backend Engineer
backend.description:
Weâ€™re about to convince you that you need a new jobâ€¦ and that youâ€™ve just found the perfect opportunity. Weâ€™re steadily growing, and weâ€™re continuously looking to expand our team with experienced Python engineers.Join Reef Technologies and work on your own terms:
Contribute from wherever you like â€“ we are fully remote.
Pick your own working hours individually. We only hold ~2 calls per week.
Work with dynamic startups from all over the world on the projects of your choice.
Contribute to the decision-making process and influence the way we operate.
Choose the projects you want to work on. We receive enough offers to only accept the ones that we like.
Remuneration on a B2B contract:
45-70 USD or 190-295 PLN per hour, or
7560-11760 USD or 31920-49560 PLN a month if you do 40 hours per week
Flexible work schedule (measured by time tracker).
We usually adjust the hourly rates once a year.
Additional perks of working at Reef Technologies:
We offer a stable position at an established company in a booming industry.
All decision-makers, including the Founder, are Senior Python Engineers.
We cover reasonable coworking space expenses.
Youâ€™ll be assigned a private assistant to save time on personal obligations.
Youâ€™ll get financial help to buy the necessary hardware.
Youâ€™ll work in a multicultural environment where everyone has a say.
Youâ€™ll get to use your English skills on an everyday basis.
Youâ€™ll get to take advantage of our flexible leave policy.
And donâ€™t forget that youâ€™ll be free to work wherever and whenever you want to. We believe that youâ€™ll do your part by independently taking the right decisions.Our only expectation timewise is for you to contribute around 30â€“40 hours per week, which we believe is optimal for sustainable full-time engagement in a remote setting. Youâ€™re free to distribute those hours throughout the week in the way that you find the most convenient, within reason.We want to ensure proper work-life balance and create an environment where you can focus on your code while at work, and on whatever brings you pleasure in your free time.Â That is why, as one of our benefits, we offer the services of a private assistant. Appointments, research, online shopping, and more â€“ you choose which tasks to pass on to your assistant.Expert Python engineer wantedDo you have at least 5 years of programming experience â€“ not necessarily professional â€“ including at least a year with Python? If so, you have probably written so much Python code in your life that at times you want to express your thoughts through list comprehensions. Thanks to your extensive experience, you can solve any problem that gets thrown at you, but that is not enough â€“ you come up with multiple solutions for every issue, and you always know how to choose the most Pythonic one.And that is all a good sign â€“ a sign that means youâ€™re exactly the type of person that weâ€™re looking for! If youâ€™d like to see what itâ€™s like to work with Python natives who all bring their long-standing expertise to the table, please get in touch. Spoiler alert: itâ€™s great.We have good manners, though, so let us introduce ourselves first. Do you want to find out more about the company? We were hoping youâ€™d ask.Get to know your future companyReef Technologies is a fully remote Python backend software house. Weâ€™re a small, agile, senior-only team. All of our current members have more than seven years of strong experience, so we donâ€™t ever have anything urgent to fix. We only deliver stable solutions, as we have developed a system that has delivered more than a hundred challenging projects in the last three years. Weâ€™d like to improve it even further with you on the team.The demand for our work is extremely high, so we get to pick and choose the projects that we want to take on â€“ and the same goes for you. Before youâ€™re assigned to a project, youâ€™ll be personally asked if youâ€™re interested in that particular task and if you donâ€™t like it, youâ€™ll just get something else. Thatâ€™s the beauty of having a sales team that greatly outperforms our delivery capacity.Let your code have a real impactAt Reef Technologies, we donâ€™t have managers. Thanks to the group decision-making framework, Sociocracy 3.0, every member of the team can be sure that their opinion will be valued. (Check it out here, youâ€™ll wonder how youâ€™d survived in traditional organizations until now!)Â The Founder of our company doesnâ€™t only take care of sales, bureaucracy, and client relationships - he is also a programmer, so all of us really do work together and understand the job at hand.What type of projects would you work on? We mainly accept offers from startups and small-to-medium businesses from the US, the UK, and Canada. Some projects may only last a couple of hours, while others take even a few years for us to complete. There is one thing that you can be sure of, though - that it will always be your personal choice whether to work on a particular project or reject it. What would you have thought about these?
financial data warehouse, which aggregates over 31 000 time series into a few hundred charts for a fintech company from London
graph data search/visualization system for auditors/investigators from Norway
super scalable WAF optimized down to extremely low running costs for a client from Chicago, IL
multisource cloud object synthesizer library for a storage provider from San Mateo, CA
report generator/inventory tracker for an e-commerce/healthcare company from Canada
k8s-based revenue optimizer for large private GPU compute clusters in North America
paper product level tracker for toilet cleaners from Canada
hydrant certification report generator for Australian plumbers
multi-tenant hospitality management system for large properties in the US
large scale information display system for retailers (international)
We have already delivered those, but you can be sure weâ€™ve got even more exciting projects coming up in the future.Â All that without ever setting foot in an office. We have completed those projects â€“ and many more â€“ from the comfort of our own homes, from tropical beaches and from our favorite coffee shops. Some of us work early in the morning, others start off late in the night. Each of us is free to choose their own programming environment. We know our engineers are competent enough to organize their work and achieve top productivity in their own way. Do you think you'd enjoy this type of freedom? Become one of us and make the world a better place by delivering more than just lines of code.Want to know more?
Check out the Reef Technologies Handbook to see our company policies.
Want to see what our clients have to say about our work? Weâ€™re quite proud of our Clutch profile.
Get to know the Founder, PaweÅ‚ Polewicz, through his 30-minute talk about building teams with the best programmers out there and why being great at programming is not enough to be considered a top dev.
Did the part about Sociocracy 3.0 sound exciting? See how we explain exactly how it works with examples.

frontend.title: Senior Frontend Software Engineer
frontend.description:
DescriptionLocation:Â Warsaw, Cracow, GdaÅ„skAbout VoltVolt is revolutionising how people pay online, globally. Our technology frees consumers from cards by letting them â€˜Pay by Bankâ€™. Itâ€™s effortless. Itâ€™s lightning fast. Itâ€™s the future. For businesses everywhere, itâ€™s transformative.Weâ€™re already trusted by leading brands around the world, but the real-time revolution is only just beginning. Having raised $83.5m, weâ€™re accelerating our mission of delivering real-time payments, everywhere. And thatâ€™s where you come in.We need world-class talent to create a world where consumers pay, and businesses get paid, instantly. With headquarters in London and offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, KrakÃ³w and Warsaw â€“ and an all-star team already in place â€“ weâ€™re sure youâ€™ll fit right in.About the projects
Fuzebox is our customersâ€™ command and control centre. Itâ€™s where they manage integrations to Voltâ€™s products, monitor transactions and access valuable data. As a Frontend Software Engineer, youâ€™ll work across the user-facing development lifecycle, building leading-edge disruptive financial technology solutions using React, TypeScript, Redux, Storybook and Playwright.
Checkout is a set of interfaces for payment requests processing. This is where the payer selects their bank and provides all the necessary details to initialize the payment. Youâ€™ll be using NX, React, (Svelte, NodeJS), TypeScript and CSS.
What the role involves:
Develop frontend software applications using your extensive knowledge of React, TypeScript and CSS,
Participate in software design meetings and analyse user needs to determine technical requirements,
Write efficient, reusable and maintainable code, whilst adhering to coding standards,
Use of modern frameworks to make the optimum solution that fits the requirements,
Test and maintain these software products to ensure continuing strong functionality,
Recommend improvements to existing software packages,
Manage time appropriately and clearly communicate changes in effort or scope,
Contribute to documentation where required,
Maintain a high awareness of industry issues and trends.
About you:
You have at least 4-5 years of experience in developing web applications,
You have in-depth knowledge of the React and its ecosystems,
We expect you to have practical experience of state and side effects management patterns and solutions (e.g. Redux, Redux Toolkit, Redux-Saga, Vuex),
You have experience with TypeScript,
You have experience working in an Agile, CI/CD environment,
You are focused on delivering a quality product using best practices,
You have excellent analytical, problem-solving, and technical troubleshooting skills,
You have experience collaborating on software projects with design and backend aspects,
You have a strong eye for compelling visual and user-centered design,
You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and can adapt to changing requirements,
You possess strong communication skills, ability to explain your decisions to the team in written and spoken English.
Nice to have:
You have experience in writing tests for React application utilising Vitest and Playwright,
You have worked on maintaining a component library using Storybook and Chromatic,
You have worked with monorepo using NX,
Prior experience with FinTech products.
What happens next?
Selected candidates will be invited for an initial interview with our People & Culture representative. The video meeting will take approximately 30-45 minutes,
Then itâ€™s time for a technical interview! The meeting will be conducted by two Technical Recruiters from Frontend area and will last 1.5 hours,
Our SVP of Technology would also like to chat with you :) You can expect the meeting to last approximately 45 minutes,
If successful, you will be given a job offer proposal.
Benefits
We champion â€˜extreme ownershipâ€™ â€“ being not just the owner of your own tasks, but a key member of a team united by, and accountable for, common goals,
During the week we mostly work remotely but for those who prefer to be in the office we arranged coworking spaces in Warsaw (Business Link Astoria) and Cracow (Loftmill),
Every week our employees meet and enjoy working together at the Puro Hotels in Cracow (on Thursdays), Warsaw (on Tuesdays) and Gdansk (Mondays). There is always an opportunity to eat lunch together and grab some drinks after hours,
Every occasion is a good reason for celebration; we organise Christmas parties and company retreats,
We care about our employeesâ€™ health, so you will be provided with Multisport card and medical insurance by Luxmed,
We offer paid holidays (pssst...we will give you one day off extra for your birthday),
In addition, once every two months on Friday we close down all comms at Volt - a digital detox. The whole business is officially ordered to take the day off!
If you want to work in a company with a great, start-up atmosphere, you donâ€™t have to look further :)
At Volt, diversity and inclusion are integral to our culture.We believe in hiring for cultural add, embracing difference and fostering a safe space where everyone can bring their authentic selves. Our mission is to transform the payments industry and this is only possible through the power of our diverse and talented team.Join us in making real-time payments accessible for all.

Â

fullstack.title: Remote Mid FullStack JS Developer
fullstack.description:
We're a forward-thinking tech crew looking for a seasoned Fullstack JavaScript Developer. We value both the nitty-gritty of coding and the broader picture of project execution.Requirements:

Client-Centric Approach: You should have hands-on experience in:
Working directly with clients.
Translating their needs into tangible technical requirements.
Delivering projects that meet commercial standards.
Core Tech Expertise:

Backend: We primarily use Node with NestJS. You should be comfortable building scalable and efficient backend systems with this stack.

Frontend: Our projects leverage the power of React/Next.js. We're expecting you to craft responsive and efficient frontends using these.

Mobile: Given the rising mobile-first approach, experience with React Native is essential. You should be adept at creating seamless mobile experiences for varied device specifications.

English Proficiency: Fluent communication is key. You should be comfortable at a B2 level, both written and spoken. We'll assess this during our chat. Polish native is required.


Soft Skills: Beyond the code:

Collaborative mindset: We work as a team. Sharing knowledge and seeking feedback should be second nature to you.

Problem-solving: Hiccups happen. How you address them matters.

Clear communication: Can you simplify complex tech jargon for clients or non-tech teammates?

Adaptive Thinking: Tech environments are dynamic. Can you adjust your strategies based on new data or unexpected challenges?

Proactive Anticipation: Spotting potential roadblocks ahead of time and devising solutions can save a lot of time and resources.
Additional Qualities (Good-to-have):

Broader Tech Knowledge: Familiarity with other modern frameworks or tools can be a plus. Let us know if you have any specialties.

Agile Experience: If you've worked in agile environments or have been part of scrum teams, it can be advantageous.

Portfolio/GitHub: Show us what you've built or contributed to. It always helps to see tangible work.
Perks & Benefits:

Straightforward Recruitment: We respect your time. Our 3-step process is designed to be quick yet thorough.

Flex Work Environment: Work from anywhere, really. Just ensure you're aligned with sprint goals and deliverables. We trust you to know your best productive times.

Personal Development Budget: Need to upgrade your workstation? Or eyeing a course? We allocate a budget for your professional growth and tools.

Skill Enhancement: We host in-house training sessions, especially for soft skills. It's optional, but we recommend it. Always good to refine those interpersonal skills.
Take The Leap with Your CV... Or Go the Extra Mile!While we're keen to see your CV, we also appreciate those who think outside the box. How about recording a brief video about yourself and your journey so far? If you're more comfortable expressing yourself in Polish, feel free to do so! Taking this initiative won't go unnoticed. In fact, it's precisely the kind of drive and creativity we value.Should you choose this path, we promise you two things:
You'll be bumped up the list and receive priority during our selection process.
You're guaranteed a spot in the first stage of our interview.
It's your chance to stand out. Show us not just what you've done, but who you are.So, ready to get started? Send in that CV or surprise us with something unique! We're excited to see what you bring to the table.

fullstack.title: Senior full-stack developer (React+Ruby on...
fullstack.description:
Offer description About us
If you are looking for a remote job that offers the excitement of working for a start-up, a high level of autonomy, respects your personal life, and provides a supportive environment â€“ then HeroCoders might be the company for you.
AtÂ HeroCoders, we help people manage their work by creating great apps for everyday tasks. As aÂ Platinum Atlassian Partner, we make tools that are used by over 50 000 companies worldwide. We have a million active users and ~50% annual growth. While we are proud of those accomplishments, much remains to be done. Thatâ€™s why we are looking for another great person to join us and help us grow and succeed.
We are a small team of 16 people working remotely from around the world. Our founders were software developers, even now, 10 of us are developers. Last year we started building a customer support team which has now grown to 3 people. In less than a year, weâ€™ve seen a tremendous impact on the quality of the support our customers receive. We also hired our first product manager at the end of 2022. We are building new teams to ensure continuous growth and improvement in our products and in the service our customers receive.
Who are we looking for:
Youâ€™re a software developer with over 5 years of professional experience and youâ€™ve spent at least 3 of those years working with React and Ruby on Rails. You aim to write easy-to-maintain software. You like working in a self-managing team with autonomy and a proactive approach to problems.
Note: You will work with a team of people located in Europe, Canada, and central Africa. We work synchronously, so a minimum 4h overlap with UTC +1 is necessary regardless of where you live.
Benefits:

Long-term B2B contract: 25k-32k PLN net + VAT/month or 70k-90k USD annually.
30 days of paid, annual leave
Fully remote position
Annual profit-sharing program
One-week-long hackathon event each quarter
20% time on side projects and activities
Control over your professional development, youâ€™ll have the freedom to choose your path
Be part of a small company and participate in business decisions

How Youâ€™ll Work at HeroCoders

Be a part of the solutionYou donâ€™t have to limit yourself to only discuss the products you are working on. We also want you to help HeroCoders grow to new heights. As we like to say: â€œIt takes a village to raise a startupâ€.
Team over egoYou will be working with highly motivated and opinionated individuals. Speak your mind, be bold, challenge others and be willing to be challenged by others. Then use the best arguments, real data, and your experience to shape the best decisions together.
Live where you wantWe didnâ€™t need a pandemic to teach us what remote work is. Weâ€™ve been a remote company since day one. Youâ€™re welcome to live anywhere as long as thereâ€™s some time overlap with Central Europe.
No crazy hoursThere may be rare occasions when things get crazy and extra hours are needed, but you can take time off to compensate. But overall, we prefer to work smarter than harder as weâ€™re in this for the long haul and donâ€™t want anyone to burn out.
RetreatItâ€™s great to work anywhere, but we also believe itâ€™s great to meet and have some fun together. We try to organize at least one annual retreat to spend quality time together, eat great food, have a drink, and talk about life.

Our technical stack
We run our apps on Heroku. We use:

JavaScript (ES6) and React with Atlaskit components
Ruby on Rails
Jetbrains IDEs (Rubmine, Webstorm)
PostgreSQL
Heroku, NewRelic/Datadog, PagerDuty, Sentry, CircleCI, etc.
Atlassian tools, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket
 read more
